H0.text: Who wrote the 20th century verse play Murder in the Cathedral. W.H. Auden

H1.text: Who wrote the 20th century verse play Murder in the Cathedral. Christopher Fry

H2.text: Who wrote the 20th century verse play Murder in the Cathedral. Dylan Thomas

H3.text: Who wrote the 20th century verse play Murder in the Cathedral. T.S.E.

A4.text: George Bell, the Bishop of Chichester, had been instrumental in connecting Eliot with the producer E. Martin Browne for the production of The Rock, and later commissioned Eliot to write another play for the Canterbury Festival in 1935. This one, Murder in the Cathedral, concerning the martyrdom of Thomas Becket, was more under Eliot's control.

A5.text: He wrote seven plays, including Murder in the Cathedral (1935) and The Cocktail Party (1949).
